metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3340 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Xen 4.2.x through 4.5.x does not initialize certain fields, which allowscertain remote service domains to obtain sensitive information from memoryvia a (1) XEN_DOMCTL_gettscinfo or (2) XEN_SYSCTL_getdomaininfolistrequest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3340` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-utils-common - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xenstore-utils - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.6').
